--- title: Collaborative filtering keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Tools to quickly get the data and train models suitable for collaborative filtering" ---
{% raw %}

Gather the data¶

class TabularCollab[source]

TabularCollab(df, procs=None, cat_names=None, cont_names=None, y_names=None, block_y=None, splits=None, do_setup=True, device=None) :: TabularPandas

A DataFrame wrapper that knows which cols are cont/cat/y, and returns rows in __getitem__

class CollabDataLoaders[source]

CollabDataLoaders(*loaders, path='.', device=None) :: DataLoaders

Base DataLoaders for collaborative filtering.

path = untar_data(URLs.ML_SAMPLE)
ratings = pd.read_csv(path/'ratings.csv')
ratings.head()
userId movieId rating timestamp
0 73 1097 4.0 1255504951
1 561 924 3.5 1172695223
2 157 260 3.5 1291598691
3 358 1210 5.0 957481884
4 130 316 2.0 1138999234 
to = CollabDataLoaders.from_df(ratings, bs=64)
to.device

device(type='cuda', index=0)
dls = CollabDataLoaders.from_df(ratings, bs=64)
dls.show_batch()
userId movieId rating
0 242 1198 5.0
1 78 356 5.0
2 587 608 4.0
3 387 1704 5.0
4 111 587 1.5
5 262 2716 2.5
6 294 380 4.0
7 134 586 2.5
8 544 1136 5.0
9 165 608 3.0 
x,y = dls.one_batch()

Models¶

class EmbeddingDotBias[source]

EmbeddingDotBias(n_factors, n_users, n_items, y_range=None) :: Module

Base dot model for collaborative filtering.

model = EmbeddingDotBias(50, len(dls.classes['userId']), len(dls.classes['movieId']), y_range=(0,5)).cuda()
out = model(x)
assert (0 <= out).all() and (out <= 5).all()

model = EmbeddingDotBias.from_classes(50, dls.classes, 'userId', 'movieId', y_range=(0,5)).cuda()
out = model(x)
assert (0 <= out).all() and (out <= 5).all()

class EmbeddingNN[source]

EmbeddingNN(emb_szs, layers, **kwargs) :: TabularModel

Subclass TabularModel to create a NN suitable for collaborative filtering.

emb_szs = get_emb_sz(dls.train_ds, {})
model = EmbeddingNN(emb_szs, [50], y_range=(0,5)).cuda()
out = model(x)
assert (0 <= out).all() and (out <= 5).all()

Learner¶

collab_learner[source]

collab_learner(dls, n_factors=50, use_nn=False, emb_szs=None, layers=None, config=None, y_range=None, loss_func=None, opt_func='Adam', lr=0.001, splitter='trainable_params', cbs=None, metrics=None, path=None, model_dir='models', wd=0.01, wd_bn_bias=False, train_bn=True, moms=(0.95, 0.85, 0.95))

Create a Learner for collaborative filtering on data.

learn = collab_learner(dls, y_range=(0,5))

learn.fit_one_cycle(1)
epoch train_loss valid_loss time
0 2.557128 2.495771 00:00
